In consequence of the numerous Applications to obtain Places for the Representation of

The Tragedy of Rienzi"

The Public is respectfully informed, that it will be presented every Friday Evening until further flotice,
and upon those Nights, the F R E E L I S T will be suspended ; the Public Press excepted.

The Tragedy of The Gamester
Was, on Wednesday Night, again received with unbounded Applause, by an elegant and crowded
Audience, who marked their decided Approbation of Miss P H I L L I P S in the arduous character
of Mrs. Beverly, and it will be repeated To-morrow Evening.

Miss Rosa Byrne,
I'pon her 10th Appearance, having astanislu-d and delighted a orilliant and overflowing House, will
perform in the new DIVERTISEME*T tvert/ Evening, Thursday excepted.

Theatre Royal, Prury Lane,
IN reply to a statement contained in " The Morning Journal" of yesterday,

I Certify, that no Gasometer, Chamber, or receptacle for GAS, i s
BOW or evei h a s been, p l a c e d w i t h i n t h e w a l l s of O r a r y T ne Theatre" but t1mt those Part8 °f the Theatre> at Present -*ff*'«i ™itJi Ga$, are
u plied from the Main of the Chartered Gas Company, -xhich leads through Russellstreet ; and, upon the same principle, the Chartered Company are noib employed to light
a portion of Covent Garden Theatre.
I beg leave to add, that the King's Theatre, the Adelphi, and English Opera
house, are also supplied from the Mains of the above Company.
JOHN EVANS,
Superinteadant of the Chartered Gas Light and Coke Company,'
Horaeferry Road, Weatrmaxter.

Theatre Royal, Drury Lane.
IN reply to a statement contained in " The Morning Journal" of Tuesday;

l Certify, that no Gasometer, Chamber, or receptacle for GAS, is
now or ever h a s been, p l a c e d w i t h i n the w a l l s of Drary* ne Theatre" but that those parts of the Theatre, at present lighted with Gas, are
sv plied from the Main of the Chartered Gas Company, whicJi leads through RusseUUreeti and, upon the sime principle, the Chartered Company are now employed to light
•j portion of Covent Garden Theatre.
J beg leave U add, that the Kings Theatre, the Adelphi, and English Opera
knuse are also supplied from the Mains of the above Company.
House,
n
J
JOHN EVANS,
Superinteodant of the Chartered Gas Light and Coke Company,
Horseferry Soad, Westminster.

A G R A N D MISCELLANEOUS ACT

preparation for the Lent Season.

Shaks[)tare's i lay o f C Y M B E L l f S E , on its revival on M o n d a y E v e n i n g , was received with unbounded
Applause by an elegant and crowded Audience, who marked their decided approbation of Miss PHILLIPS in the
arduous Character of Imogen, and it will be repeated on Monday next.

In consequence of the unprecedented demand for Boxes.

The New Opera of MASANIELLO
W i l l be repeated E V E R Y

NIG^T;

And during its RUN, to accommodate the Nobility, Gentry, and Public at large.

The Doors of the Theatre will be opened a t a Quarter past Six,
and the Box-Office will not close till Five o Clock;
An additional P I T DOOR will likewise be thrown open,

And all Orders totally suspended 1
This Evening, MONDAY, May 11, 1829,

&RAND

IN

*lntiques!

Which he will represent en a Pedestal. This Arrangement is made in order to convey to the Classical Taste of
Artists, in an effective manner, a series oi the beautiful Compositions of Ancient Sculpture.
The following is the Order of the Portraiture.
1, Hercules struggling with the Neraean Lion, in the 8.—Romulus, from David's Picture of the Sabines.
9.—Remus's Defence, from the same.
Six Attitudes.
10.—Horatius Shielding his prostrate Brother from the
2.—Apollo, throwing the Discus or Quoit.
uplifted weapons of the opposing Curiatii, the3.—Cincinnati^ the Roman, fastening his Sandals.
eldest of whom is afterwards pourtrajeC ia the act
4—The Slave Emouleur, (the Grinder) sharpening his
of aiming a deadly thrust at his Adversary. To
Knife while overhearing the Conspirators.
conclude with the famous Positions of
5.—The Fighting Gladiator, in Three Positions.
11.—The Dying Gladiator.
6.—The African alarmed at the Thunder.
7.—Ajax defying the Lightning.

Theatre Royal Drury Lane
MONDAY, November 30, 1829,

l& The Public is respectfully informed, that
latfc on Saturday night an Injunction from the
Court of Chancery, obtained upon an exparte statement, was served upon Mr. 1LEA1V;---this will necessarily prevent his acting this Evening.—An
application to dissolve the Injunction will be made
Fo-morrow,upon the L O R D CHANCELLORS return
from Brighton,—and it is hoped Mr. KEAN will
be allowed to appear on Wednesday
next.
The VK&y of
